meanings.sent1: The pond was full of duckier birds swimming gracefully.
meanings.sent2: The duckier toy in the store caught the child's attention.
meanings.sent3: The duckier costume at the party was a big hit with everyone.
meanings.sent4: The duckier clouds in the sky resembled a flock of ducks flying south.

meanings.sent1: The puppy's duckier eyes melted everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent2: The duckier kitten played with a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent3: The duckier smile on the baby's face made everyone smile back.
meanings.sent4: The duckier flowers in the garden attracted many bees.
meanings.sent5: The duckier teddy bear was the favorite toy of the child.

meanings.definition: To lower the head or body suddenly to avoid a blow or missile
meanings.sent1: He quickly duckiered to dodge the flying ball.
meanings.sent2: She duckiered just in time to avoid the swinging branch.
meanings.sent3: The ninja duckiered under the sword, impressing everyone.
meanings.sent4: The player duckiered and caught the opponent off guard.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's swift duckiering added flair to the performance.
